column1: #Text=[0155] Next, the CPU 10 determines whether or not the calculated inner product is larger than the value of the waiting threshold value data 131 (a step S65).

#Text=In the present embodiment, since the value of "-1" is set in advance as a value of the waiting threshold value data 131, for example, in FIG. 26, if the inner product is "-1", it can be determined that the acceleration has not shifted across the dotted line L14.
#Text=If the inner product is smaller than "-1", it can be determined that the acceleration has shifted across the dotted line L14.

#Text=[0156] As a result of the determination at the step S65, when it is determined that the inner product is not larger than (i.e. equal to or smaller than) the value of the waiting threshold value data 131 (NO at the step S65), the reverse acceleration recognition processing is terminated.

#Text=On the other hand, when it is determined that the inner product is larger than the value of the waiting threshold value data 131 (YES at the step S65), it is considered that the acceleration has not shifted across the dotted line 14, and thus, next, the CPU 10 determines whether or not the timer 135 is larger than a time limit (a step S66).
#Text=Here, the time limit is a predetermined constant number.

#Text=The determination is made for when a predetermined time period elapses, assuming that the acceleration has shifted across the dotted line L14 even if the acceleration has not actually shifted across the dotted line L14.

#Text=In other words, in order to execute subsequent processing even when it is not detected for a long time that the acceleration has shifted across the dotted line L14, the time limit is set for determining whether or the acceleration has shifted across the dotted line L14.
#Text=As a result of the determination, when the value of the timer 135 is within the time limit (NO at the step S66), the CPU 10 returns to the processing at the step S62.
#Text=On the other hand, when the value of the timer 135 exceeds the time limit (YES at the step S66), the reverse acceleration recognition processing is terminated.
#Text=This is the end of the description of the reverse acceleration recognition processing.
#Text=[0157] Referring back to FIG. 18, when the reverse acceleration recognition processing at the step S4 is terminated, next, the CPU 10 executes stability determination processing (the step S5).

#Text=In this processing, as described with reference to FIG. 16, a determination is made as to whether or not the acceleration which has shifted across the waiting threshold value has returned to the vicinity of the origin.
#Text=[0158] FIG. 29 is a flow chart showing in detail the stability determination processing shown at the step S5.
#Text=As shown in FIG. 29, the CPU 10 sets "0" at the timer 135 (a step S71).
#Text=Then, the CPU 10 adds "1" to the timer 135 (a step S72).
#Text=[0159] Next, the CPU 10 executed difference acceleration calculation processing as described above (a step S73).
#Text=This processing is the same as the processing at the step S23, and hence the description thereof will be omitted.
